page.content: { 12:}SILVER BIRCH trees have tiny wind dispearsed seeds helping them to be early colonisers of bare ground. On the right there are patches of GORSE that has yellow flowers but is dominated by BRAKEN which creates a deep peaty soil as it decays. { 13:}These young OAKS originate from acorns possibly hidden by JAYS. This area is a stage in the succesion from open heath to woodland. { 14:}MATURE OAKS provide a rich food supply with over 300 species of insect feeding on them, and these in turn attract feeding birds. The VIEW is along the{R.Frome Water Meadows}to the distant skyline of the{Purbeck {Hills. } { 15:}POND and HEATH INFORMATION BOARDS. In the fence near the old oak, is a BADGER GATE to prevent the fence being damaged by badgers.
